blog.name: ky-thewolf
blog.title: a junkyard of my mind
blog.description: Ky | 17 | they/them | bi/panromantic, grey-asexual | my fanfics: AO3 / Wattpad | Dan and Phil, Harry Potter, Riordanverse, Voltron, Merlin, FNaF and a whole lotta other bulshet

summary:
A year ago, adventures
Across the earth to be seen
By everyone watching
From the other side of the screen
Began with leg one
On...
body:
II anniversary

A year ago, adventures

Across the earth to be seen

By everyone watching

From the other side of the screen

Began with leg one

On an afternoon in Brighton

And at last the world could see it

At last they turned the light on.

Everyone had fun

All the energy of the cheers

Put smiles on the faces

Of ourselves and of our peers;

We felt breathless and delighted

Even after the curtain closed

We were all excited for the future

And for the rest of the shows.

We hoped we would all be able

To give them something back

To thank them for all they’ve given us

When our worlds were feeling black;

They gave us light

They gave us hope

They made us laugh

And helped us cope

And now the tour has been and gone

And we remember all the best

Times we’ve had and friends we’ve met

Now Dan and Phil can rest

Knowing they’ve made all our lives better

Simply by existing

And doing what they love to do

Because we’ll always be there listening.

Words can wear out

But their meanings remain

Held in our hearts

Like the shadows they have slain

Our broken alones

Became one with the herds

A community connected

By a love of two nerds.

this is my Interactive Introverts wristband; i have worn it every single day virtually 24/7 since i went to see the very first show, the Brighton matinee, a year ago today. as you can see, the word ‘introvert’ has all but worn away, but i still wear the wristband because after wearing it for so long i feel almost lost without it. in the same way, i would feel lost without Dan and Phil themselves and the amazing community of people i’ve met who love them and their content

in summary: @danielhowell and @amazingphil , ty ly bb - we look forward to the future xx

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: I've been thinking about Dan and Phil and their content and how they can build out their fanbase so its not just phannies.......
question: I've been thinking about Dan and Phil and their content and how they can build out their fanbase so its not just phannies.... which is fine but can sometimes be annoying. Podcasts really are popular and almost everyone listens to them. They were amazing on radio. Maybe podcasting can be a new platform for them to explore where they can bring the old fanbase and make new fans who dont really watch youtube. What do you think????
answer: I think that considering the success they have each had on multiple platforms throughout their careers, they probably have plenty of opportunities available to them should they want to branch out. Given their experience in radio, I think they could be very successful with a podcast. However, especially if they were going to do a podcast together, I think they would have to really change up their dynamic if they wanted to avoid appealing mostly to phannies. I think the biggest thing they each need to do if they ever decide that they want to try to gain back some of the people who outgrew them over the years or appeal to a new audience is to drop the personas. A podcast would be a great medium for that and considering how enjoyable people found Dan’s liveshows, I think it would be a great medium for him in particular. Who knows what he wants at this point though?

reblog.comment: I think that considering the success they have each had on multiple platforms throughout their careers, they probably have plenty of opportunities available to them should they want to branch out. Given their experience in radio, I think they could be very successful with a podcast. I think the biggest thing they each need to do if they ever decide that they want to try to gain back some of the people who outgrew them over the years or appeal to a new audience is to drop the personas. A podcast would be a great medium for that and considering how enjoyable people found Dan’s liveshows, I think it would be a great medium for him in particular. Who knows what he wants at this point though?

However, especially if they were going to do a podcast together, I think they would have to really change up their dynamic if they wanted to avoid appealing mostly to phannies. I think the biggest thing they each need to do if they ever decide that they want to try to gain back some of the people who outgrew them over the years or appeal to a new audience is to drop the personas. A podcast would be a great medium for that and considering how enjoyable people found Dan’s liveshows, I think it would be a great medium for him in particular. Who knows what he wants at this point though?

Given their experience in radio, I think they could be very successful with a podcast. However, especially if they were going to do a podcast together, I think they would have to really change up their dynamic if they wanted to avoid appealing mostly to phannies. Who knows what he wants at this point though?
